intro: Plagiobothrys mollis var. mollis, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as plains and disturbed areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
